author: Thoughty2
description: Every cell in your body takes up 3GB of data and the average body has about 30 trillion cells! That means you’re walking around with around 90 zettabytes of data just by existing. This means you could theoretically store all of the world’s data in just two humans - but you’d have to remove that genome data first! DNA is like a data bank which stores the instructions for how to make a replica of you, down to the smallest possible detail.
title: Could a Human Be Better Than the Cloud for Storing Data?
